description: Numbers that are congruent to {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6} mod 8.
comments: The product of any two terms belongs to the sequence and therefore also a(n)^2, a(n)^3, a(n)^4 etc. - _Bruno Berselli_, Nov 28 2012
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-2,2,-2,2,-1)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
